verses.verse: Then sang<WH7891> Moses<WH4872> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> this song<WH7892> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and spake<WH559>, saying<WH559>, I will sing<WH7891> unto the LORD<WH3068>, for he hath triumphed<WH1342> gloriously<WH1342>: the horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> hath he thrown<WH7411> into the sea<WH3220>.

The LORD<WH3050> is my strength<WH5797> and song<WH2176>, and he is become my salvation<WH3444>: he<WH2088> is my God<WH410>, and I will prepare him an habitation<WH5115>; my father's<WH1> God<WH430>, and I will exalt<WH7311> him.
The LORD<WH3068> is a man<WH376> of war<WH4421>: the LORD<WH3068> is his name<WH8034>.
Pharaoh's<WH6547> chariots<WH4818> and his host<WH2428> hath he cast<WH3384> into the sea<WH3220>: his chosen<WH4005> captains<WH7991> also are drowned<WH2883> in the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>.
The depths<WH8415> have covered<WH3680> them: they sank<WH3381> into the bottom<WH4688> as<WH3644> a stone<WH68>.
Thy right hand<WH3225>, O LORD<WH3068>, is become glorious<WH142> in power<WH3581>: thy right hand<WH3225>, O LORD<WH3068>, hath dashed in pieces<WH7492> the enemy<WH341>.

And in the greatness<WH7230> of thine excellency<WH1347> thou hast overthrown<WH2040> them that rose up against<WH6965> thee: thou sentest forth<WH7971> thy wrath<WH2740>, which consumed<WH398> them as stubble<WH7179>.

And with the blast<WH7307> of thy nostrils<WH639> the waters<WH4325> were gathered together<WH6192>, the floods<WH5140> stood upright<WH5324> as an heap<WH5067>, and the depths<WH8415> were congealed<WH7087> in the heart<WH3820> of the sea<WH3220>.

The enemy<WH341> said<WH559>, I will pursue<WH7291>, I will overtake<WH5381>, I will divide<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998>; my lust<WH5315> shall be satisfied<WH4390> upon them; I will draw<WH7324> my sword<WH2719>, my hand<WH3027> shall destroy<WH3423> them. destroy: or, repossess
Thou didst blow<WH5398> with thy wind<WH7307>, the sea<WH3220> covered<WH3680> them: they sank<WH6749> as lead<WH5777> in the mighty<WH117> waters<WH4325>.

Who is like unto thee, O LORD<WH3068>, among the gods<WH410>? who is like thee, glorious<WH142> in holiness<WH6944>, fearful<WH3372> in praises<WH8416>, doing<WH6213> wonders<WH6382>? gods: or, mighty ones?
Thou stretchedst out<WH5186> thy right hand<WH3225>, the earth<WH776> swallowed<WH1104> them.

Thou in thy mercy<WH2617> hast led forth<WH5148> the people<WH5971> which <WH2098> thou hast redeemed<WH1350>: thou hast guided<WH5095> them in thy strength<WH5797> unto thy holy<WH6944> habitation<WH5116>.
The people<WH5971> shall hear<WH8085>, and be afraid<WH7264>: sorrow<WH2427> shall take hold<WH270> on the inhabitants<WH3427> of Palestina<WH6429>.

Then<WH227> the dukes<WH441> of Edom<WH123> shall be amazed<WH926>; the mighty men<WH352> of Moab<WH4124>, trembling<WH7461> shall take hold<WH270> upon them; all the inhabitants<WH3427> of Canaan<WH3667> shall melt away<WH4127>.

Fear<WH367> and dread<WH6343> shall fall<WH5307> upon them; by the greatness<WH1419> of thine arm<WH2220> they shall be as still<WH1826> as a stone<WH68>; till thy people<WH5971> pass over<WH5674>, O LORD<WH3068>, till the people<WH5971> pass over<WH5674>, which <WH2098> thou hast purchased<WH7069>.

Thou shalt bring<WH935> them in, and plant<WH5193> them in the mountain<WH2022> of thine inheritance<WH5159>, in the place<WH4349>, O LORD<WH3068>, which thou hast made<WH6466> for thee to dwell in<WH3427>, in the Sanctuary<WH4720>, O Lord<WH136>, which thy hands<WH3027> have established<WH3559>.
The LORD<WH3068> shall reign<WH4427> for ever<WH5769> and ever<WH5703>.

For the horse<WH5483> of Pharaoh<WH6547> went in<WH935> with his chariots<WH7393> and with his horsemen<WH6571> into the sea<WH3220>, and the LORD<WH3068> brought again<WH7725> the waters<WH4325> of the sea<WH3220> upon them; but the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH1980> on dry<WH3004> land in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>.

And Miriam<WH4813> the prophetess<WH5031>, the sister<WH269> of Aaron<WH175>, took<WH3947> a timbrel<WH8596> in her hand<WH3027>; and all the women<WH802> went out<WH3318> after<WH310> her with timbrels<WH8596> and with dances<WH4246>.

And Miriam<WH4813> answered<WH6030> them, Sing<WH7891> ye to the LORD<WH3068>, for he hath triumphed<WH1342> gloriously<WH1342>; the horse<WH5483> and his rider<WH7392> hath he thrown<WH7411> into the sea<WH3220>.

So Moses<WH4872> brought<WH5265> Israel<WH3478> from the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>, and they went out<WH3318> into the wilderness<WH4057> of Shur<WH7793>; and they went<WH3212> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> in the wilderness<WH4057>, and found<WH4672> no water<WH4325>.

And when they came<WH935> to Marah<WH4785>, they could<WH3201> not drink<WH8354> of the waters<WH4325> of Marah<WH4785>, for they were bitter<WH4751>: therefore the name<WH8034> of it was called<WH7121> Marah<WH4785>. Marah: that is Bitterness
And the people<WH5971> murmured<WH3885> against Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>, What shall we drink<WH8354>?

And he cried<WH6817> unto the LORD<WH3068>; and the LORD<WH3068> shewed<WH3384> him a tree<WH6086>, which when he had cast<WH7993> into the waters<WH4325>, the waters<WH4325> were made sweet<WH4985>: there he made<WH7760> for them a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941>, and there he proved<WH5254> them,

And said<WH559>, If thou wilt diligently<WH8085> hearken<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, and wilt do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in his sight<WH5869>, and wilt give ear<WH238> to his commandments<WH4687>, and keep<WH8104> all his statutes<WH2706>, I will put<WH7760> none of these diseases<WH4245> upon thee, which I have brought<WH7760> upon the Egyptians<WH4714>: for I am the LORD<WH3068> that healeth<WH7495> thee.

And they came<WH935> to Elim<WH362>, where were twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> wells<WH5869> of water<WH4325>, and threescore and ten<WH7657> palm trees<WH8558>: and they encamped<WH2583> there by the waters<WH4325>.
